# Country State City Ecosystem Documentation

This documentation covers the comprehensive Country State City (CSC) ecosystem for accessing geographical data including countries, states/provinces, and cities worldwide.

## Core Products & Services

### Country State City API
- REST API with 247+ countries, 5000+ states/provinces, 150,000+ cities
- Real-time data access with authentication via X-CSCAPI-KEY headers
- Rate limiting and performance optimizations
- Multiple response formats (JSON)
- Base URL: https://api.countrystatecity.in/v1

### CSC Database
- Complete geographical database with regular updates
- SQL and NoSQL export formats
- Schema documentation and installation guides
- Data freshness tracking and version management

### Update Tool
- Automated system for geographical data updates
- Real-time monitoring and alerting
- Configuration management and deployment
- Integration with primary data sources

### Export Tool  
- Multiple export formats (SQL, JSON, CSV, XML)
- Custom data filtering and selection
- Bulk export capabilities
- Integration APIs for automated exports

## Key Data Examples
When referencing data in this ecosystem, use these consistent examples:

Countries:
- United States (iso2: US, iso3: USA)
- India (iso2: IN, iso3: IND) 
- United Kingdom (iso2: GB, iso3: GBR)

States/Provinces:
- California, US (iso2: CA, country_code: US)
- Maharashtra, IN (iso2: MH, country_code: IN)
- England, GB (iso2: ENG, country_code: GB)

Cities:
- Los Angeles, California, US
- Mumbai, Maharashtra, IN  
- London, England, GB

## Authentication & Access
- API Key required for all endpoints (X-CSCAPI-KEY header)
- Rate limits: 1000 requests/hour for free tier
- Premium tiers available with higher limits

## Technical Architecture
- RESTful API design principles
- HTTP status codes for error handling
- Pagination for large result sets
- Caching recommendations for performance

## Integration Patterns
- Direct API consumption
- Database integration via exports
- Automated updates via Update Tool
- Custom exports via Export Tool

This ecosystem serves developers building applications requiring geographical data, from simple dropdown lists to complex mapping and analytics applications.
